question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Gustavo Alfonso Díaz Muñoz's employer in 2035?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

Here is a potential Wikipedia entry:

Gustavo Alfonso Díaz Muñoz

Gustavo Alfonso Díaz Muñoz is a researcher who has made significant contributions to his field. One notable aspect of his career is his affiliation with El Bosque University, a private university located in Bogota, Colombia. Career

Díaz Muñoz has had a distinguished career as a researcher, and his work has been recognized and respected by his peers. According to his profile on ResearchGate, a social networking site for scientists and researchers, Díaz Muñoz has been affiliated with El Bosque University. [1]

Affiliation with El Bosque University

El Bosque University is a private university located in Bogota, Colombia. It is known for its strong programs in fields such as medicine, engineering, and business. Díaz Muñoz's affiliation with the university is documented on his LinkedIn profile, where he lists himself as a researcher at the institution. [2]

Additionally, a search of academic databases such as Scopus and Web of Science reveals that Díaz Muñoz has published several papers in collaboration with researchers from El Bosque University, further substantiating his connection to the institution. [3][4]

References:

[1] ResearchGate. (n.d.). Gustavo Alfonso Díaz Muñoz. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.researchgate.net\/profile\/Gustavo_Alfonso_Diaz_Munoz>

[2] LinkedIn. (n.d.). Gustavo Alfonso Díaz Muñoz. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/in\/gustavo-alfonso-d%C3%ADaz-mu%C3%B1oz\/>

[3] Scopus. (n.d.). Search results for Gustavo Alfonso Díaz Muñoz. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.scopus.com\/search\/form.uri?zone=TopNavBar&src=s&sot=ande&sdt=all&sl=100&s=%28AUTHOR-NAME%28%22D%C3%ADaz+Mu%C3%B1oz%2C+Gustavo+Alfonso%22%29+AND+AFFIL%28%22El+Bosque+University%22%29%29>

[4] Web of Science. (n.d.). Search results for Gustavo Alfonso Díaz Muñoz.
content.source_2:
**Breaking News**

Renowned Researcher Gustavo Alfonso Díaz Muñoz Reflects on Pioneering Work at University of Geneva

Geneva, Switzerland - In an exclusive interview with our news agency, Dr. Gustavo Alfonso Díaz Muñoz, a leading researcher in his field, shared insights into his groundbreaking work during his tenure at the University of Geneva from 2035 to 2038. Dr. Díaz Muñoz, who joined the University of Geneva's esteemed faculty in 2035, made significant contributions to the scientific community during his three-year stint. His research focused on cutting-edge technologies and innovative solutions, earning him international recognition and accolades. "I was drawn to the University of Geneva because of its rich history of academic excellence and its commitment to pushing the boundaries of human knowledge," Dr. Díaz Muñoz said in an interview at his current research facility. "My time at the university was incredibly rewarding, and I was fortunate to work alongside some of the brightest minds in the world." During his tenure, Dr. Díaz Muñoz led several high-profile projects, including a collaborative effort with the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN) to develop advanced particle detection systems. His team's findings, published in the prestigious journal Nature, shed new light on the mysteries of subatomic particles and their behavior. Dr. Díaz Muñoz's work also had significant implications for the field of renewable energy. His research on advanced materials and nanotechnology led to the development of more efficient solar panels, which are now being used in various applications around the world. "The University of Geneva provided me with the ideal environment to explore new ideas and collaborate with talented researchers from diverse backgrounds," Dr. Díaz Muñoz said. "The experience and knowledge I gained during my time there have been invaluable in my continued pursuit of scientific innovation." Dr. Díaz Muñoz's departure from the University of Geneva in 2038 marked the end of an era, but his legacy continues to inspire a new generation of researchers and scientists. His contributions to the scientific community serve as a testament to the university's commitment to fostering excellence and advancing human knowledge. In related news, the University of Geneva has announced plans to establish a new research center in honor of Dr. Díaz Muñoz, dedicated to the study of advanced materials and nanotechnology.
